11.60.text: [Alan Watts:] If you awaken from this illusion

16.82.text: and you understand that black implies white

27.14.text: or shall I say death implies life

38.79.text: Not as a stranger in the world.

41.54.text: Not as something here on probation.

44.86.text: Not as something that has arrived here by fluke.

49.87.text: But you can begin to feel your own existence

57.94.text: I'm not trying to sell you on this idea

60.22.text: in the sense of converting you to it.

62.67.text: I want you to play with it.

64.69.text: I want you to think of its possiblities.

66.38.text: I'm not trying to prove it

68.06.text: I'm just putting it forward as a possibility of life to think about

74.94.text: Let's suppose that you were able every night,

77.38.text: to dream any dream you wanted to dream.

81.73.text: And that you could for example have the power

85.61.text: within one night to dream seventy five years of time.

90.28.text: Or any length of time you wanted to have.

94.36.text: And you would naturally, as you began on this adventure of dreams,

97.45.text: you would fulfill all your wishes.

102.53.text: You would have every kind of pleasure.

110.50.text: of seventy five years of total pleasure each,

113.56.text: you would say "Well that was pretty great!"

116.25.text: "But now let's - let's have a surprise".

119.42.text: "Let's have a dream which isn't under control".

124.50.text: "Where something is going to happen to me

126.04.text: but I don't what it's going to be."

132.78.text: And come out of that you'd say

134.25.text: "Wow that was a close shave wasn't it?"

138.34.text: Then you would get more and more adventurous

141.30.text: and you would make further and further gambles

145.86.text: Finally you would dream where you are now.

151.82.text: You would dream the dream of living the life

153.33.text: that you are actually living today.

156.73.text: That would be within the infinite multiplicity

160.19.text: of choices that you would have.

162.17.text: Of playing that you weren't God.

167.05.text: Because the whole nature of the God in you

171.26.text: according to this idea, is to play that he's not.

174.38.text: So in this idea then, everybody is fundamentally

178.10.text: the ultimate reality, not God in a politically kingly sense,

183.90.text: but God in the sense of being the self.

188.34.text: The deep down basics, whatever there is.
